page.title: 17DAY IN THE LIFE OF A NUN
page.content: The sisters get up at 6am,get dressed ready for their first service at 7.10am.They have a second service at 7.30am.At 8.00am they have breakfast, wash up, and a few more chores around the house.The next service is at 9.00am.Each time there is a service, the bell calls them in to the chapel.On Monday,for example the morning is spent doing washing. At 12.00pm the Sisters attend the 5th service of their day.This service is when they pray for people-visitors to St Francis,friends,families,and people who are sick or in need.After that it is lunch time and then another service at 1.10pm.Afternoons are generally spent on gardening or making soft toys.5.pm is teatime,6.pm is vespers.The evenings are for relaxing.At 9.oopm:Compline service, held at night,reciting Psalms usually.
